newsitem.title: USA: New stocks garner interest from analysts - daily.
newsitem.headline: New stocks garner interest from analysts - daily.

text.p: Companies that have issued shares on the stock exchange for the first time this year have generated interest among analysts because their prices have remained close to original offerings, the New York Times reported Sunday.
Although they were unlikely to turn a quick profit, the shares were probably a good investment for the long term, the newspaper said.
Analysts recommended companies like Raptor Systems Inc that make security software for use on the Internet, it said.
Communications companies such as Powerwave Technologies Inc were also garnering some interest, it added.

The newspaper said analysts also recommended Donnelley Enterprise Solutions, which offers computer and business services, airline reservations business Sabre Group and Panavision Inc, which makes camera systems for the movie industry.
